intro: Arnebia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered arnebia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Arnebia macrocalyx prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates.
